items.name: Economic Impacts of AI Openness Regulation
items.description: Regulatory frameworks, such as the EU AI Act, encourage openness of general-purpose AI models by offering legal exemptions for 'open-source' models. Despite this legislative attention on openness, the definition of open-source foundation models remains ambiguous. This paper presents a stylized model of the regulator’s choice of an open-source definition to evaluate how AI openness standards will impact developers’ incentives.
